body: One of Europe’s most sought after weekend destinations, Gothenburg has evolved from an industrial port into a modern city packed with culture, fun and fabulous food.  Visitors can immerse themselves in a hipster vibe, reminiscent of Berlin or Amsterdam, while wandering through cobbled streets, exploring via canal boat or hanging out in one of the characterful boroughs: Linnéstaden (also known as Linné), Majorna and Rosenlund (the fish-packing district), which all boast independent bars, cafes and shops.   Related: Why I commute to London – from Sweden’s west coast    Situated on the west coast of Sweden, fresh fish and seafood arrive in Gothenburg every morning; there’s a buzzing cafe and coffee shop scene – and seven Michelin-starred restaurants. The jewel of Götaplatsen (the city’s public square) is the Gothenburg Museum of Art, which houses collections from the 15th century onwards. A tour of the Gothenburg archipelago, a short boat ride from the mainland, is breathtaking. If you’d love to explore Gothenburg and West Sweden, enter this competition for your chance to win a fantastic three-night break. The prize includes two return flights from the UK and a hire car, to be collected from the airport upon arrival. ItineraryThe lucky winner will head to Salt & Sill on Klädesholmen, known as “Herring Island”, for the first night. Sweden’s first floating hotel, it opened in 2008 after being constructed at a nearby quay in Wallhamn to avoid disrupting the island’s calm. Salt & Sill is also a restaurant, with a menu inspired by local ingredients and coastal influences. Enjoy the fresh fish, shellfish and specialty “herring plate”, served with an uninterrupted sea view. After a peaceful night at Salt & Sill, including breakfast, the winner can explore Klädesholmen, an old fishing community dating back to the 15th century, before driving on to Gothenburg. In the city, competition winners can relax over two nights at the central Clarion Hotel Post. A trendy venue set in an old post office, the original architecture has been preserved alongside a new section that includes a spa, two bars and rooftop pool. There are two restaurants, the Norda Bar & Grill, a fusion of New York and Gothenburg cuisines, and vRÅ, serving sushi and raw food. A nutritious and filling breakfast buffet is also included. And, to help the winner get the best out of Gothenburg, the prize also includes a Göteborg City Card, which gives you free admission to lots of sights, excursion, transport and entertainment, including Liseberg, one of the most popular amusement parks in Scandinavia. The prize will be supplied by Taber Holidays – a specialist tour operator to Scandinavia since 1973. With its in-depth expertise knowledge, Taber Holidays can create tailor-made itineraries to Sweden. For your chance to win, simply enter your details below.
